\bentry

\gl{\kirxvi}
{\dictmeaning{\num{1} -kikxMta hecAcxgi; -kikxMta hecucx nijavAgi,
 niSakxqqSaTxvAgi, saMBavaniVyavAgi,

adu keTaTxdudx enunxvudakikxMta oLeLxyadu enunxvudeV yukatx. \eng{it
is derived rather from imagination than reason} vicArakikxMta hecAcxgi
adu kalapxneyiMda huTiTxdudx. \eng{orderliness is not the result, it is
rather the cause of law} vayxvasithxta sithxtiyu shAsanada
pariNAmavalalx, adakikxMta hecAcxgi adu shAsanada mUla. \eng{late last
night, or rather early this morning} kaLeda rAtirx sari hotitxnalilx,
athavA inUnx KacitavAgi, iMdu muMjAne bahumuMce. 
\num{2}
savxlapxmaTiTxge; alapxsavxlapx; koMcamaTiTxge: \eng{I rather think
you know him} Atananunx niVvu balilxreMdu (koMcamaTiTxge) nanage
aninxsutatxde. \eng{he was rather a failure} avanu savxlapxmaTiTxge
ayashasivxyeMdeV heVLabeVku. \eng{it was rather good} alapxsavxlapx
cenAnxgitutx. 
\num{3} -kikxMta muMce, modalu; -kikxMta meVleMdu,
oLeLxyadeMdu, leVseMdu, takukxdeMdu, hitavAdadedxMdu, ucitaveMdu,
utatxmaveMdu BAvisi: \eng{he would much rather die than refuse} ilalx

rather than hard} upupx yA cwLu niVrigiMta lavaNarahita niVranunx

story to his children} Ata katheyanunx makakxLigAgi,
makakxLedurinalilx Odida. \eng{read aloud} gaTiTxyAgi Odu. 

\alnum{d} BASeya sAkaSuTx tiLivaLikeyiMda, paricayadiMda (A BASeya garxMtha \mo
vanunx) Odi athaRmADiko: \eng{he is able to read French} avanu
pherxMcanunx, pherxMcinalilxruva pusatxka \mo vanunx

\alnum{e} (noVTadiMdalalxde, beraLugaLiMda muTiTx) Odu:

\alnum{f} (citarxlipi, SATfR hAyxMDf yA beVre saMkeVtagaLalilxruva barehavanunx
ADuva BASege mApaRDisi) OdiheVLu: \eng{he can read hieroglyphics} Ata

\alnum{g} (viVkaSxNa yA pariVkaSxNadiMda

ari: \eng{he read the dark, cloudy sky as the harbinger of a storm}

munfsUcaneyanunx aritukoMDa. \eng{read the sky} AkAshakAyagaLanunx
viVkiSxsi KagoVLavanunx arituko. 

\alnum{h} (keY \mo vanunx noVDi)
BaviSayx heVLu: \eng{read a person's hand} vayxkitxya keY noVDi
BaviSayxheVLu. \eng{read a dream} savxpanxda mamaRvanunx
heVLu; savxpanxvu sUcisuva Palavanunx heVLu. 

\alnum{i} Odi atheYRsu; athaR -- heVLu, biDisu: \eng{read the
riddle} ogaTanunx (Odi) biDisu. \eng{read an omen} shakuna

\num{2} 
\alnum{a}
(vayxkitxya cahare \mo vugaLiMda) avana aMtaraMgavanunx heVLu;
mamaRvanunx BeVdisu, ari: \eng{read men's thoughts} vayxkitxgaLanunx noVDi avara manasisxnalilxna
vicAragaLanunx ari. \eng{read men's face} vayxkitxgaLa muKa noVDi
avara manasasxnunx ari. 

\alnum{b} vayxkitxya mAtugaLanunx keVLi yA avana saMjecnxgaLanunx
noVDi arituko yA atheYRsu. 
\num{3} athaYRsu; (heVLike, vataRne, \mo

\num{4} (garxMthada yA
saMpAdakana \vi) (kataqRvina pAThaveMdu Uhisi) pAThavanunx,
pAThAMtaravanunx koDu: \eng{Bently reads `peraeque'} beMTilxyu
\eng{peraeque} eMba pAThavanunx koTiTxdAdxne. 
\num{5} (mudarxNa)

\alnum{a} karaDanunx pariVkiSxsu, sarinoVDu, saritapupxgaLanunx
gamanisu. 

\alnum{b} (tapupx bareha yA acacxnunx tidudxvalilx)

\bentry
\word[reason(1)]{reason}
\pron{riVsaznf}
\gl{\nA}
{\dictmeaning{
\num{1} kAraNa; vAda, manaHperxVraNe, dheyxVya, heVLikeya
samathaRnegaLanunx rujuvAtupaDisuvudakAkxgi maMDisuva vAsatxvAMsha:
\eng{prove with reasons} kAraNagaLiMda samathiRsu, rujuvAtu
mADikoDu. 
\num{2} (\takaR) (silojisaM takaRsaraNiyalilx niNaRyisida
anumAnavanunx modaleV heVLi, baLika adakekx kAraNavAgi heVLida)
parxdhAna yA upaparxtijecnx (\kanmu\ upaparxtijecnx), \udA\ 

\alnum{a} \eng{all men are mortal, and Socrates is mortal, for he is a
man}. 

\alnum{b} \eng{Socrates is a man, and he is mortal as all men are
mortal}. 
\num{3} takaR (shakitx); parxtijAcnx vAkayxgaLiMda
anumAnavanunx niNaRyisuva, mAnavana vishiSaTx lakaSxNavAda
budidhxsAmathayxR. 
\num{4} (vayxkitxVkarisida) budidhx: \eng{God and
reason are identical} BagavaMta hAgU budidhx eMbavu ananayxvAdavu;
BagavaMta eMdarU oMdeV budidhx eMdarU oMdeV.  
\num{5} budidhx; citAtxsAvxsathxyX: \eng{he has lost his
reason} avanige citatxsAvxsathxyX keTiTxde. 
\num{6} viveVka; viveVcane: 

\alnum{a} vayxvAhAra jAcnxna; viveVkayuta vataRne;
nAyxyaniVti. 

\alnum{b} loVka mayARde; loVkarUDhi; vihitavAda,
atireVkakekx hoVgada, elelxmiVrada vataRne: \eng{I will do anything in
reason} loVkamayARdege oLapaTaTx yAvudanenxV Agali mADalu nAnu
sidadhx. 

\alnum{c} nAyxyasamamxtavAdadudx; yukatxvAdadudx. 

\alnum{d} nAyxya; nAyxyasamamxtavAda, yukatxvAda mAtu: \eng{hear reason}
nAyxyavanunx keVLu. \eng{listen to reason} yukatxvAda mAtige
kivigoDu. 

\alnum{e} yukAtxyukatx parijAcnxna; nAyxyayukatxte;
aucitayx: \eng{there is reason in what he says} avanu heVLuvudaralilx
aucitayxvide. 
\num{7} udedxVsha; kAraNa; samathaRne: \eng{has good
reasons for doing this} idanunx mADalu oLeLxya kAraNagaLanunx
hoMdidAdxne. \eng{no reason to be angry} siTATxgalu
kAraNavilalx. 
\num{8} sahajajAcnxna; aMtaboRVdhe; budidhx,
garxhaNashakitxyanunx miVrida nigamana takaRsUtarxgaLanunx odagisuva
sahajajAcnxnashakitx.}}

\noindent
\gl{\pagu}
\dictmeaning{\num{1} \eng{as reason was} viveVcanege toVridaMte;
viveVcaneyu perxVreVpisidaMte. 
\num{2} \eng{bring to reason}
nAyxyada dArige yA viveVkada mAgaRkekx taru. 
\num{3} \eng{by reason of} A kAraNadiMda:
\eng{the institution failed by reason of its bad organisation} A
saMsethxyu adara aBadarxvAda saMGaTaneyiMda viPalagoMDitu. 
\num{4}
\eng{have reason} (ninage) yukAtxyukatx parijAcnxna irali;
aucitayxjAcnxna irali. 
\num{5} \eng{in (\engit{or} within) reason}
viveVcaneya yA mitiya elelxyoLage. 
\num{6} \eng{listen to reason}
viveVkadiMda vatiRsuvaMte Agu; nAyxyakekx kivigoDu. 
\hyperdef{R}{reason(1) pagu(7)}{}
\num{7} \eng{see reason} 

\alnum{a} vAdada yukatxteyanunx ari. 

\alnum{b} budidhxbaru;
viveVka taMduko, gaLisiko, paDeduko; viveVkadiMda vatiRsu. 
\num{8} \eng{stand to reason} 

\alnum{a} visapxSaTxvAgiru: \eng{it stands to
reason that nobody will work without pay} saMbaLavilalxde yArU
duDiyuvudilalx eMbudu elalxrigU sapxSaTxvAda, tiLida
saMgati. 

\alnum{b} takaRsamamxtavenisu: \eng{what he says stands to
reason} avanu heVLuvudu takaRsamamxtavenisutatxde. 
\num{9} \eng{with reason} sakAraNavAgi; nAYxyavAgi: 
\eng{he complains with reason} avanu sakAraNavAgiyeV dUrutitxdAdxne; avanu dUrutitxruvudu nAyxyavAgiyeV ide.
\num{10} \eng{without rhyme or reason}
nAyxya -- niVti yAvudU ilalxde. 
\num{11} \eng{woman's reason}
sitxrXVtakaR; heMgasina vAda saraNi, riVti; oMdu heVLikege A
heVLikeyanenxV kAraNavanAnxgi yA vivaraNeyanAnxgi punarucacxrisuvudu;
punarukitx takaR, \udA\ \eng{I love him because I love him} avananunx
pirxVtisuvudariMda nAnavananunx pirxVtisutetxVne.}
\eentry

\bentry
\word{receive}
\pron{risiVvf}
\gl{\sakirx}
{\dictmeaning{
\num{1} (koTaTxdadxnunx yA taMdopipxsidadxnunx) tegeduko;
opipxsiko; sivxVkarisu; aMgiVkarisu: \eng{receive an invitation}
kareyanunx, AhAvxnavanunx sivxVkarisu. \eng{receive a petition}
ajiRyanunx tegeduko, aMgiVkarisu.
\num{2} (UreyAgidudx BAra \mo vanunx) hotutxko; tegeduko; Aniko; Atuko: 
\eng{the arch receives the weight of the roof} A kamAnu CAvaNiya BAravanunx
hotutxkoMDide. \eng{they received his body in their hands} avana
deVhavanunx avaru keYyalilx AtukoMDaru. 
\num{3} (\rUpa) (peTuTx, noVvu,
manasisxguMTAda AGAta, \mo vanunx) tALiko; taDeduko; sahisiko: \eng{he
received the shock with equanimity} A AGAtavanunx avanu
samacitatxdiMda tALikoMDa. 
\num{4} (saMGa, saMsethx \mo vakekx)
seVrisu; parxveVsha koDu: \eng{they received him into the church}
avananunx avaru caciRge, pAdirxya vaqtitxge, seVrisikoMDaru. 
\num{5} oLakekx baragoDu; oLage eDegoDu, avakAsha koDu, AsapxdakoDu:
\eng{I had to receive his visits} avana BeVTigaLige nAnu 
eDegoDabeVkAyitu. 
\num{6} sivxVkArakekx -- IDAgu, pAtarxvAgu,
BAjanavAgu: \eng{the basin received Chirst's blood} A boVguNiyu
kirxsatxna rakatxkekx BAjanavAyitu. \eng{he was fitted to receive the
knowledge of God} deVvaranunx kurita jAcnxnakekx avanu
pAtarxvAgidadx. 
\num{7} hiDi; hiDisu; hoVgalu avakAsha hoMdiru:
\eng{the hole was large enough to receive two men} A gUDu ibabxru
hiDisuvaSuTx doDaDxdAgitutx. 
\num{8} (gurutu, muderx, BAvane, \mo
vanunx) taLe; paDe; horu; hoMdiru; taLeduko: \eng{receive a stamp}
muderxyanunx hoMdu, paDe. \eng{receive an impression} BAvaneyanunx
taLeduko. 
\num{9} horu; hotutxko; vahisu: \eng{he who has received our
yoke} nAvu horisida nogavanunx, hoNeyanunx hotutxkoMDavanu. 
\num{10} (soVlanunx) opipxko: \eng{the town received the French contingent} A
paTaTxNavu pherxMcf paDege soVlanonxpipxtu. 
\num{11} baramADiko; 
baragoDu: \eng{he shall not be received at my house} avananunx nananx
manege baragoDuvudilalx.
\num{12} atithiyAgi yA aBAyxgatananAnxgi
satakxrisu, Adarisu: \eng{he that receiveth me receiveth Him that sent
me} nananxnunx aBAyxgatananAnxgi yAvanu AdarisutAtxnoV avanu
nananxnunx kaLuhisidavananenxV (BagavaMtananenxV) AdarisidaMte. 
\num{13} -riVtiyalilx sAvxgatisu; purasakxrisu yA
tirasakxrisu: \eng{he was received with cries of `Traitor'} avananunx
`dorxVhi' eMdu kUgi sAvxgatisidaru. \eng{stay here and receive
him} ililxyeV idudx avananunx sAvxgatisu. 
\num{14} nijaveMdu naMbu;
opupx, aMgiVkarisu: \eng{an axiom universally received}
savaRsAmAnayxvAgi aMgiVkaqtavAda savxtasisxdadhx sUtarx. \eng{they
have not received our report} namamx varadiyanunx avaru nijaveMdu
opipxlalx. 
\num{15} paDe: \eng{receive a letter} (yoVgakeSxVmada yA
itara) kAgadavanunx paDe. 
\num{16} paDe; (salalxbeVkAdadudx) dore:
\eng{I have not yet received my dividend} nanage salalxbeVkAda
lABAMsha nanaginUnx doretilalx. \eng{it deserves more attention than
it receives} adakekx doretiruva gamanakikxMta hecucx gamana adakekx
salulxtatxde. 
\num{17} (apamAna, gwrava, daMDane \mo vanunx) hoMdu;
paDe; anuBavisu: \eng{receive insults} apamAnagaLanunx
anuBavisu. \eng{receive honour} gwrava hoMdu. \eng{receive punishment}
shikeSxyanunx, daMDaneyanunx paDe. 
\num{18} pAlu, BAga -- paDe:
\eng{received his portion} tananx pAlanunx paDeda. 
\num{19} (parxsAra mADida saMkeVtagaLanunx) dhavxnigaLAgi yA citarxgaLAgi parivatiRsu. 
\num{20} (Tenisf)savfR mADuvavana ceMDanunx paDeyuva
ATagAranAgu. 
\num{21} (\kanmu\ \birx) (tiLidU) kaLaLxmAlanunx
sivxVkarisu, tegeduko.}}

\bentry
\word{refer}
\pron{ripharf}
\gl{\kirx} (\BU\ matutx \BUkaq\ \eng{referred}; \vakaq\
  \eng{referring}). 

\noindent
\gl{\sakirx}
{\dictmeaning{
\num{1} (yAvudeV viSayakekx, vayxkitx \mo varanunx) mUla yA kAraNa
eMdu AroVpisu; heVLu: \eng{refer one's victories to Providence} tananx
vijayagaLigelalx deYvakaqpeyeV kAraNa eMdu heVLu. 
\num{2} (yAvudeV viSayavanunx, oMdu kAla, sAthxna yA vagaRkekx)
seVridedxMdu heVLu; saMbaMdha kalipxsu: \eng{refer the lake-dwellings
to the sixth century} saroVvarada nivAsagaLanunx Araneya
shatamAnadaveMdu heVLu. 
\num{3} (vayxkitxyanunx yA tananxnenxV, yA payARloVcanegAgi oMdu
viSayavanunx, vayxkitxge yA saMsethxge) opipxsu; vahisikoDu;
biTuTxkoDu: \eng{let us refer the dispute to the Director} I
vAyxjayxvanunx payARloVcanegAgi nideRVshakarigeV
opipxsibiDoVNa. \eng{I refer myself to your generosity} nAnu
nananxnunx tamamx audAyaRkekx biTuTxkoMDidedxVne. 
\num{4} (agatayxvAda satAyxMshavanunx kaMDuhiDiyuvudakAkxgi adanunx
balalx adhikAriyanunx, adu doreyuva parxmANa garxMtha yA beVre
Akaravanunx) Asharxyisu; keVLu yA avaloVkisu. 
\num{5} parxmANavanunx, Akaravanunx--ulelxVKisu, etitxtoVrisu,
udadhxrisu: \eng{for proof I refer to the facts of the matter}
rujuvAtigAgi nAnu I viSayada satAyxMshagaLanunx ulelxVKisutitxdedxVne. 
\num{6} (keVLutitxruvavana \vi) oMdu viSayakekx anavxyisu,
saMbaMdhagoLisu: \eng{these remarks refer only to deliberate offences}
I TiVkegaLu budidhxpurasasxravAgi mADida aparAdhagaLige mAtarx
anavxyisutatxve. \eng{these remarks are not to be referred to
involuntary offences} I TiVkegaLanunx tiLiyade mADida aparAdhagaLige
anavxyisalAgadu. 
\hypertarget{refer sakirx(7)}{}
\num{7} (mAtanADutitxruvavana \vi) parxsAtxpisu; sUcisu; nideRVshisu;
gamanaseLe: \eng{he referred to the increase in expenditure} KacuR
hecicxruvudanunx avanu parxsAtxpisida. \eng{he was on the peak
referred to} Ata hiMde sUcisida shiKarada meVlidadx. 
\num{8} (vayxkitxyanunx) veYdayxkiVya shAsatxrXdalilx tajacnx \mo vara baLige kaLisu. 
\num{9} (parxsAtxvane \mo vanunx) hiMdirugisu; matetx hiMdakekx
(keLagina saMsethx, koVTuR \mo vugaLige) kaLuhisu. 
\num{10} (aBayxthiRyanunx pariVkeSxyalilx) napAsAgisu; anutitxVNaRgoLisu.}}

\noindent
\gl{\akirx}
{\dictmeaning{
\num{1} (heVLike \mo vugaLa \vi) anavxyisu; saMbaMdhisu: \eng{this
paragraph refers to the events of last year} I pAyxrA kaLeda vaSaRda
GaTanegaLanunx sUcisutatxde. 
\num{2} (yAvudoV parxmANa yA mAhitiya mUlada) 

\alnum{a} neravu, sahAya--koVru. 

\alnum{b} (avanunx) Asharxyisu; avalaMbisu: \eng{referred to his
notes} tananx TipapxNigaLanunx Asharxyisida. 
\num{3} (mAtanADutitxruvavana \vi) 

\alnum{a} sUcisu; ulelxVKisu. 

\alnum{b} (keVLuvavana) gamana seLe: \eng{decided not to refer to our
other problems} namamx itara samaseyxgaLatatx gamana seLeyadiralu
tiVmARnisidevu. 
\num{4} (mAhiti \mo vugaLigAgi) noVDu; avaloVkisu: \eng{refer to a
dictionary} koVshavanunx noVDu.}} 

\noindent 
\gl{\pagu}
\dictmeaning{
\num{1} \eng{refer back to = \hyperlink{refer sakirx(7)}{refer (\sakirx\ $7$)}} 
\num{2} \eng{referred pain} deVhada oMdu aMgaBAgadalilx, adara
nijavAda mUlakikxMta beVre kaDe kANisikoMDa, noVvu. 
\num{3} \eng{refer to drawer (= R.D.)} (cekukx \mo vanunx
nagadugoLisade, adanunx baredukoTaTxvanigeV kaLuhisabeVkeMdu bAyxMkina
adhikAriyu cekikxna meVle namUdisuva TipapxNi) cekukxdAtananenxV
keVLi.} 
\eentry

\bentry

\gl{\nA}
{\dictmeaning{
\num{1} (yAvudeV viSayavanunx takakx adhikAriya niNaRya, tiVmARna yA

\num{2} (niNaRya, tiVmARna yA parAmashaRnegAgi vahisida) viSayada yA
parAmashaRna niyamagaLa vAyxpitx: \eng{the peerage was allowed without
reference to the House of Lords} hwsf Aphf lADfsxR saBeya
parAmashaRnakekx opipxsadeyeV A piyarf padavige mananxNe
niVDalAyitu. \eng{that is a question outside the terms of reference} A
parxshenx parAmashaRnada niyamAvaLiya vAyxpitxge horatAdadudx. 
\num{3} saMbaMdha yA AnuguNayx: \eng{success seems to have little
reference to merit} ahaRtegU saPalategU iruva saMbaMdha tiVra
alapxveMdu toVrutatxde. 
\num{4} hoMdike; anurUpate: \eng{the parts of a machine have reference
to each other} oMdu yaMtarxda BAgagaLalilx parasapxra hoMdike
irutatxde. 
\num{5} parxsAtxpa; parxkaraNadoDane iruva saMbaMdhada nideRVsha,
ulelxVKa: \eng{a reference to a previous conversation was made}
hiMdina oMdu saMBASaNeya parxsAtxpavanunx etatxlAyitu. 
\num{6} 
\alnum{a} (parxsAtxpisiruva viSayavu doreyuva garxMthaBAga \mo
vugaLige, \kanmu) nidiRSaTx puTakekx saMbaMdhisida nideRVshana,
sUcane; Akarada, ulelxVKada dAKale: \eng{he does not give references}
Ata ulelxVKagaLa dAKalegaLanenxV koTiTxlalx. 

\alnum{b} hAge ulelxVKisida pusatxka yA BAga. 
\num{7} (Odugana gamanavanunx aDiTipapxNi, reVKAcitarx, \mo vakekx
seLeyalu baLasuva) sUciVcihenx; nideRVshacihenx, \udA\ \eng{asterisk,
obelisk, double obelisk}, itAyxdi. 
\num{8} (agatayxvAda viSayavanunx tiLidukoLaLxlu) ulelxVKa BAgavanunx
noVDuvudu yA tiLida vayxkitxyanunx keVLuvudu yA avana baLige
kaLuhisuvudu: \eng{a reference to the dictionary will solve the
problem} niGaMTinalilx ulelxVKavanunx noVDidare samaseyx
bagehariyutatxde. \eng{I should like to make reference to your last
employer} hiMde nimamxnunx neVmisikoMDidadx adhikAriyiMda viSayavanunx
keVLi tiLidukoLaLxbeVkeMdidedxVne. 
\num{9} (hudedxgAgi ajiR hAkuva yA mArATakAkxgi sarakugaLanunx taruva
vayxkitxyu) naMbikegAgi hesaru koDuva, hesarisuva, gaNayxvayxkitx,
parxmANisuva vayxkitx: \eng{who are your references?} naMbikegAgi
niVvu hesarisuva gaNayxrAru? 
\num{10} (saDilavAgi) ahaRtApatarx; shiPArasupatarx; Baravase patarx.}}

\noindent

\num{1} \eng{book of reference} parAmashaRna garxMtha;
 (saMpUNaRvAgi Odalikakxlalxde, AgiMdAgeyx ulelxVKagaLanunx
avaloVkisuva saluvAgi bareda) avaloVkana garxMtha.

unburden one's heart is a great relief} haqdayada BAravanunx

\num{6} (kAyaR \mo vanunx) anukarisu.
\num{7} (matetxmatetx bAru mADade) halavu guMDuhoDe; halavubAri hoDe: \eng{repeating rifle} halavu guMDu hoDeyuva baMdUka.
\num{8} (\AtAmx) (tananxnenxV) punarAvatiRsiko; punarAvataRneyAgu; maraLimaraLi naDe, saMBavisu: \eng{history repeats itself} naDeda cariterx tirutirugi (hiMdinaMteyeV) naDeyutatxde, punarAvatiRsutatxde.
\num{9} avadhAraNegAgi baLasuvalilx: \eng{am not, repeat not, going}
nAnu hoVgutAtx ilalx, matetx heVLutetxVne ilalx.}}

\num{5} (eMdu) heVLu; sAru; GoVSisu; parxtipAdisu; parxkaTisu;

represents himself as having seen long service} tAnu diVGaRkAla seVve

ilalx.
\num{6} (nATaka yA pAtarxvanunx) aBinayisu; parxdashiRsu.
\num{7} (oMdara) saMkeVtavAgiru; parxtiVkavAgiru; parxtikaqtiyAgiru: \eng{the sovereign represents the majesty of the State} rAjanu rASaTxrXda Ganateya parxtiVka. \eng{the circle represents perfection} vaqtatxvu paripUNaRteyanunx saMkeVtisutatxde.
\num{8} (oMdakekx) sarisamanAgiru; sarisamanAda parxmANadalilxru; anuguNavAda parxmANadalilxru: \eng{an inch of rain represents 100 tons to the acre} oMdu aMgula maLe ekarege $100$ Taninxge sarisamavAgutatxde.

 represented in the audience} shorxVtaqgaLalilx elalx bageya

biVruvaMte--heVLu, maMDisu, nirUpisu, parxtipAdisu.

\num{7} \eng{ring in one's ears (\textit{or} heart)}

\alnum{b} haqdayadalilx--nelesiru, tuMbiru.

\alnum{c} samxraNege sadA barutitxru.
\num{8} \eng{ring knell}

\alnum{b} aMtayxgoLisu; konegoLisu.
\num{9} \eng{ring off} (\birx) (gArxhakavanunx matetx adara sAthxnadalilxTuTx) dUravANi kareyanunx, saMBASaNeyanunx mugisu, aMtayxgoLisu. 
\num{10} \eng{ring out}

\alnum{a} gaMTe bArisi horakekx kaLisu. 

\alnum{b} GaMTA GoVSadiMda nigaRmanavanunx sUcisu: \eng{ring out the old year} haLeya vaSaR hoVyiteMdu GaMTAnAda mADi GoVSisu.

\alnum{c} (gaMTeyaMte) moLagu.
\num{11} \eng{ring peal} taraMga taraMgavAgi nAda horaDuvaMte gaMTegaLanunx bArisu.
\num{12} \eng{ring the bell}

\alnum{a} (\kanmu\ javAnananunx kareyuvudakAkxgi) gaMTe bArisu.

\num{13} \eng{ring the \hyperref{kandict_c.pdf}{C}{change(1) nuga(2)}{${}^1$change}s.}

\bentry
\word[run(1)]{run}
\pron{ranf}
\gl{\kirx} (\vakaq\ \eng{running}; \BU\ \eng{ran} \ucAcx\ rAYxnf; \BUkaq\ adeV).
{\dictmeaning{}}

\noindent
\gl{\sakirx}
{\dictmeaning{ 
\num{1} (nidiRSaTx darxvadiMda) tuMbi hari: \eng{rivers are said to
run blood after an engagement} yudadhxvoMdara taruvAya nadigaLu
rakatxdiMda hariyutatxve eMdu heVLalAgide.  
\num{2} (niVru \mo vanunx) harisu; hariyuvaMte mADu; surisu; sUsu;
sarxvisu (\rUpa\ saha): \eng{fountains run wine} kAraMjigaLu
madayxvanunx ukikxharisutatxve.  
\num{3} (sAnxnada toTiTxge) niVru tuMbu. 
\num{4} mAgaR hiDi: \eng{run a scent} beVTeyalilx vAsane hiDidu hoVgu. 
\num{5} anusarisu: \eng{things must run their course} GaTanegaLu tamamx hAdiyanunx, saMdaBaRgaLu tamamx mAgaRvanunx anusarisaleVbeVku. 
\num{6} (oMdaroLakekx) hogisu; tUrisu; nATisu. 
\num{7} (kirxkeTf) (bAyxTugArana \vi) ranf gaLisalu oMdu vikeTiTxniMda inonxMdakekx ODu. 
\num{8} (paMdayxvanunx, dUravanunx) ODu: \eng{run a race} OTada paMdayxdalilx ODu. 
\num{9} ale; sututx: \eng{run the streets} biVdigaLalilx ale; biVdipoVranAgu; bikAriyAgi ale. 
\num{10} IDAgu; oLagAgu: \eng{run risks} apAyagaLige IDAgu. 
\num{11} naDasu; nivaRhisu: \eng{the Derby was run in a snow-storm} DAbiR kudure jUju himapAtadalilx naDeyitu. 
\num{12} (baTeTxge) dATu holige hAku. 
\num{13} benanxTuTx; beVTeyADu: \eng{run the fox five miles} nariyanunx aidu meYli dUra aTiTxsikoMDu hoVgu. 
\num{14} (yaMtarx, vAhana \mo vanunx) ODisu; naDesu; cAlanegoLisu; ODuvaMte mADu. 
\num{15} (dana \mo vanunx) meVyalu biDu, ATuTx, hoDe: \eng{run cattle} danakarugaLanunx meVyuvudakekx hoDe. 
\num{16} (haNa salilxsuva muMce lekakxvanunx) Eralu biDu; inUnx hecAcxgalu, inUnx beLeyalu -- biDu. 
\num{17} (leVKana \mo vanunx) vqtatxpatirxke yA niyatakAlikadalilx parxkaTisu. 
\num{18} (vayxkitxyanunx) cunAvaNege nililxsu, sUcisu yA beMbalisu. 
\num{19} (vAyxpAra, udayxma \mo vanunx) nivaRhisu; naDesu; nideRVshisu. 
\num{20} (vAhanavanunx) savxMtavAgi iTuTxkoMDu niyatavAgi baLasu, ODisu. 
\num{21} oMdu nidiRSaTx riVtiyalilx ODisu, naDesu, calisuvaMte mADu: \eng{ran the car into a tree} kAranunx marakekx Dikikx hoDesida. 
\num{22} (kaNaNxnunx) sUthxlavAgi -- ODisu, ADisu: \eng{ran my eye down the page} puTada meVle sUthxlavAgi kaNANxDiside. 
\num{23} paMdayxkekx (kudure \mo vanunx) iLisu, BAgiyAgisu,
sapxdhiRyanAnxgisu.  
\num{24} (baMdUku \mo vanunx) kaLaLxsAgaNe mADu; kAnUnubAhiravAgi, kaLaLxtanadalilx (deVsha \mo vugaLa oLakekx) nugigxsu. 
\num{25} vAhanadalilx (vayxkitxyanunx) karedukoMDu hoVgu: \eng{run a person to the shop} vayxkitxyanunx aMgaDige vAhanadalilx kUrisikoMDu, karedukoMDu hoVgu. 
\num{26} (vahisida kelasa) mADu; mADi mugisu; nivaRhisu.}}

\noindent
\gl{\akirx}
{\dictmeaning{
\num{1} ODu; dhAvisu. 
\num{2} 
\alnum{a} OTa kiVLu; ODihoVgu; palAyana mADu. 

\alnum{b} tale tapipxsikoMDu, talemaresikoMDu -- hoVgu, ODu. 
\num{3} avasaravasaravAgi hoVgu, parxyANa mADu. 
\num{4} 
\alnum{a} gAligaLa meVle hoVgu, uruLu, calisu; akaSxda meVle (heVgoV
hAge) sututx; uruLikoMDu, jArikoMDu -- sAgu: \eng{time runs} kAla
uruLutitxde. \eng{rope runs in pulley} hagagx kapipxya sutatx
tirugutatxde.

\alnum{b} sarAgavAgi naDe, sAgu. 
\num{5} cAlitxyalilxru; jAriyalilxru; kAyARvadhi hoMdiru:
